title: Score system
description:
Implement scoring:
- Points per enemy destroyed:
  - Fighter (enemy_1): 100 points
  - Heavy (enemy_2): 250 points
- Bonus points for power-ups collected: 50 points
- Score multiplier for consecutive kills without taking damage
- Display current score in UI
- Track high score (localStorage persistence)
- Show final score on game over

title: Difficulty progression
description:
Implement increasing difficulty over time:
- Track elapsed game time
- Gradually increase:
  - Enemy spawn rate
  - Enemy movement speed
  - Enemy bullet frequency
  - Mine spawn rate
- Introduce enemy_2 (heavy) after ~60 seconds
- Mix formations as difficulty increases
- Cap difficulty at reasonable max level

Suggested curve: linear increase every 30 seconds

title: Collision system + explosions
description:
Implement collision detection and effects:
- Player bullets vs enemies → damage enemy, destroy bullet
- Enemy bullets vs player → damage player, destroy bullet  
- Player vs enemies → damage both
- Player vs mines → damage player
- On enemy death: play explosion animation, drop power-up chance
- On player death: play explosion, trigger game over
- Use Phaser physics overlap/collide

Explosion sprites:
- explosion_1_01 to explosion_1_11 (orange)
- explosion_2_01 to explosion_2_09 (blue)
- explosion_3_01 to explosion_3_09 (green)

title: Mines: obstacles system
description:
Implement mine obstacles:
- Create Mine class
- Use mine_1 sprites (8 frame spin animation)
- Mines spawn randomly, drift slowly downward
- Mines are indestructible (bullets pass through)
- Contact with player causes damage
- Can have mine_2 variant (different visual)

Sprites: mine_1_01 through mine_1_08 (or mine_1_09)

title: Enemy ships: spawning + formations
description:
Implement enemy ship system:
- Create Enemy class extending Phaser.GameObjects.Sprite
- Enemy types: enemy_1 (fighter), enemy_2 (heavy)
- Color variants: red, green, blue (visual variety)
- Formation patterns:
  - V-formation (5 ships)
  - Line formation (horizontal row)
  - Diamond formation
- Formations enter from top, follow paths
- Enemy tilt animation based on movement direction
- Health per enemy (fighters=1hp, heavy=3hp)
- Spawn manager with wave timing

Sprites: enemy_1_r_*, enemy_1_g_*, enemy_1_b_*, enemy_2_r_*, etc.
close_reason: Enemy spawning with V, line, and diamond formations implemented

title: Power-up system
description:
Implement power-ups dropped by enemies:
- Random drop chance on enemy death (15-20%)
- Power-up types:
  1. Health restore (green): +25 HP
  2. Weapon upgrade (red): faster fire rate, more bullets
  3. Speed boost (blue): temporary movement speed increase
- Power-ups drift slowly downward
- Disappear after ~10 seconds or leaving screen
- Visual: colored orbs or use proton sprites
- Weapon upgrades stack (level 1-3), reset on death

title: Enemy AI: shooting + movement patterns
description:
Implement enemy behavior:
- Enemies fire at player periodically
- Use plasma bullet sprites (plasma_1, plasma_2)
- Enemy bullets travel downward toward player
- Movement patterns:
  - Straight down
  - Sine wave (oscillating)
  - Diving attack (swoop toward player)
- Enemies exit if they pass bottom of screen
- Different behaviors per enemy type:
  - Fighter (enemy_1): fast, erratic, single shot
  - Heavy (enemy_2): slow, steady, burst fire

title: Game Over scene + restart
description:
Implement game over flow:
- Trigger on player health reaching 0
- Display 'GAME OVER' text
- Show final score
- Show high score
- 'Play Again' button/tap to restart
- Transition back to GameScene
- Reset all game state on restart

Simple implementation - can enhance visuals later

title: Player weapons: shooting system
description:
Implement player shooting:
- Fire bullets on spacebar / screen tap
- Use vulcan bullet sprites (vulcan_1, vulcan_2, vulcan_3)
- Bullets travel upward at fixed speed
- Auto-fire option (hold to shoot continuously)
- Bullet pooling for performance
- Fire rate limiting (cooldown between shots)
- Muzzle flash at ship position

Upgradeable properties (for power-ups later):
- Fire rate
- Bullet damage
- Bullet count (spread shot)
close_reason: Player shooting with spacebar and touch implemented

title: Touch controls for mobile
description:
Implement mobile touch controls:
- Virtual joystick (left side of screen)
  - Use Phaser plugin or custom implementation
  - Circular touch area
  - Visual feedback showing direction
- Fire button (right side) OR auto-fire on movement
- Responsive layout for different screen sizes
- Detect touch vs mouse automatically
- Test on mobile browsers

Consider: rexUI plugin for virtual joystick

title: Health system + damage
description:
Implement player health:
- Player starts with 100 HP
- Health bar UI at top of screen
- Different damage values:
  - Enemy bullet: 10 damage
  - Enemy collision: 25 damage
  - Mine collision: 20 damage
- Brief invincibility after taking damage (flash effect)
- Health reaches 0 → game over
- Visual feedback on damage (screen flash, ship flash)

title: Project setup: Phaser.js + build tooling
description:
Set up the Phaser.js project structure:
- Initialize package.json with Phaser 3 dependency
- Set up Vite for dev server and bundling
- Create index.html entry point
- Create src/main.js with Phaser game config
- Create basic scene structure (Boot, Game, GameOver)
- Verify hot reload works

Target structure:
```
father_son_games/
├── assets/
├── src/
│   ├── scenes/
│   │   ├── BootScene.js
│   │   ├── GameScene.js
│   │   └── GameOverScene.js
│   └── main.js
├── index.html
├── package.json
└── vite.config.js
```
close_reason: Complete - Phaser + Vite setup with 3 scenes, dev server running

- Test animations display correctly

Reference: assets/spritesheet.xml for sprite coordinates
